dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4805 IH: American Meat Industry Protection Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Santos introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds to support lab-grown meat, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Meat Industry Protection Act of 2023.

section.header: No Federal funds supporting lab-grown meat

subsection.text: No Federal funds may be used to support, directly or indirectly, the production, advancement, or enhancement of lab-grown meat, including throughâ€”

paragraph.text: conducting or supporting research on lab-grown meat;
supporting meatpacking plants, organizations, or groups relating to lab-grown meat; and
excluding from the receipt of any assistance or other benefit under a program administered by the Secretary of Agriculture any farm, ranch, producer, or other entity that produces lab-grown meat.

subsection.text: In this section, the term lab-grown meat means meat sourced from cells of animals and artificially produced in a laboratory.
